attributes.action: Get GP back to face to face appointment.
attributes.additional_details: If you are lucky even enough to get your call answerd, you still are only offered  phone consultation, after giving your personal symptoms  to receptionist, who are not medically  trained, I now know of many people who have had to present at a/e,and have been told if they hadn't been seen, the situation could have been a lot worse,thank goodness  for doctors on duty at a/e.It is time for GP s to do what they are paid for.
attributes.background: GP still not seeing patients.Aand E covering for them,as people left with no other alternative  but to go there for treatment.

rejection.details: There are no Government restrictions that prevent GPs from holding face-to-face appointments. Decisions relating to GP appointments, including decisions on whether face-to-face appointments are appropriate, are operational matters for the NHS and individual GPs, not the UK Government or Parliament.
